item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Tuesday, May 20, 2025 at 2:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Ogmo – free, open source, 2D level editor (35 points | 4 comments)
2. Deep Learning Is Applied Topology (24 points | 4 comments)
3. The emoji problem (2022) (180 points | 20 comments)
4. A simple search engine from scratch (132 points | 11 comments)
5. Making Video Games (Without an Engine) in 2025 (316 points | 123 comments)
6. Show HN: Text to 3D simulation on a map (does history pretty well) (18 points | 13 comments)
7. The Lisp in the Cellar: Dependent Types That Live Upstairs [pdf] (3 points | discuss)
8. DDoSecrets publishes 410 GB of heap dumps, hacked from TeleMessage (536 points | 143 comments)
9. llm-d, Kubernetes native distributed inference (16 points | discuss)
10. Have I Been Pwned 2.0 (698 points | 226 comments)
11. Show HN: JavaFactory – IntelliJ plugin to generate Java code (21 points | 2 comments)
12. Compiling OCaml to the TI-84 CE Calculator (23 points | discuss)
13. Firewalls and BIOS's and Coreboot (2020) (13 points | 3 comments)
14. Finland announces migration of its rail network to international gauge (305 points | 267 comments)
15. Jules: An Asynchronous Coding Agent (414 points | 166 comments)
16. Experts Have It Easy (8 points | 1 comment)
17. Why Does the U.S. Always Run a Trade Deficit? (73 points | 118 comments)
18. GitHub Copilot Coding Agent (500 points | 318 comments)
19. The Windows Subsystem for Linux is now open source (1430 points | 969 comments)
20. What are people doing? Live-ish estimates based on global population dynamics (206 points | 78 comments)
21. Reports of Deno's Demise Have Been Greatly Exaggerated (106 points | 103 comments)
22. I got fooled by AI-for-science hype–here's what it taught me (243 points | 183 comments)
23. Claude Code SDK (395 points | 170 comments)
24. Imagine a drive where every file exists as all file types all of the time (14 points | 26 comments)
25. CRLF Injection in `–proxy-header` allows extra HTTP headers (CWE-93) (4 points | 1 comment)
26. Launch HN: Better Auth (YC X25) – Authentication Framework for TypeScript (228 points | 84 comments)
27. Run GitHub Actions locally (259 points | 109 comments)
28. Kilo: A text editor in less than 1000 LOC with syntax highlight and search (183 points | 38 comments)
29. Biff – a batteries-included web framework for Clojure (69 points | 19 comments)
30. The behavior of LLMs in hiring decisions: Systemic biases in candidate selection (137 points | 111 comments)
